newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-ARSENAL CRUSH GEORGE GRAHAM'S LEEDS TO GO TOP.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ARSENAL CRUSH GEORGE GRAHAM'S LEEDS TO GO TOP.

text.p: Arsenal returned to the top of the English premier league when they crushed their former manager George Graham's Leeds United 3-0 at Highbury on Saturday.

Arsenal, who topped the table for 24 hours last weekend, moved ahead of Newcastle on goal difference thanks to goals from Lee Dixon, Dennis Bergkamp and Ian Wright after Newcastle lost 2-0 at Leicester.

Champions Manchester United, beaten 5-0 by Newcastle last weekend, had another defensive nightmare, losing 6-3 at Southampton where new Norwegian signing Egil Ostenstadt scored a hat-trick. United played most of the match with only 10 men after Irish international Roy Keane was sent off after 22 minutes for two bookable offences.

On an emotional afternoon across London at Stamford Bridge Chelsea beat Tottenham 3-1 in their first match since their 42-year-old vice chairman Matthew Harding was killed in a helicopter crash on Tuesday.
Chelsea player-manager Ruud Gullit scored their opening goal with David Lee (penalty) and Roberto di Matteo adding the others.
Wreaths, and a pint of Guinness -- Harding's favourite drink -- were placed in the centre-circle before kickoff and a minute's silence was held by both sets of supporters as a mark of respect.
